alert.note: Alert for Chemung; Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Steuben; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 9:46PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seneca, Schuyler, Yates, southwestern Cayuga, western Chemung and eastern Steuben Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 946 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Italy to near Rheims to near Woodhull. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Corning, Big Flats, Seneca Falls, Bath, Waterloo, Penn Yan, Hector, Romulus, Fayette and Starkey. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 near 41. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 39 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central New York.

area.areaDesc: Chemung; Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Steuben; Yates
